sen.j: 舞鶴市（まいづるし）は、京都府北部（旧丹後国）の、日本海に面する港湾都市。
sen.e: Maizuru is a harbor city located in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (old Tango Province) fronts on the Sea of Japan.
Maizuru is a harbor city located in the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Tango Province) overlooking the Sea of Japan.

sen.j: 市内東部にある軍港のほか、造船や硝子といった重厚長大産業都市として発展し、舞鶴都市圏を形成している。
sen.e: Maizuru have been developing as a military port in the eastern part of the city, and as a city of heavy industries with such as shipbuilding and glass industry, which forms Maizuru urban area.

sen.j: 港は大きく二つに分かれており、軍港から発展した東舞鶴（東舞鶴市）と、城下町商港から発展した西舞鶴（舞鶴市(～1943年5月26日)）より構成されている。
sen.e: The port is mainly made of 2 part: Higashi (east)-Maizuru (Higashi-Maizuru City) developed from the military port and Nishi (west)-Maizuru (Maizuru City from May 26th, 1943) which was originated from an old trade port of a castle town.

The port can be divided into two main parts: Higashi (east) - Maizuru (Higashi-Maizuru City), which developed as a result of the military port, while Nishi (west) - Maizuru (Maizuru City from May 26th, 1943), originated from an old trade port of a castle town.

sen.e: Maizuru fronts on Japan Sea and the Maizuru bay which splits the city to the east and the west with its ria coasts.

sen.j: 舞鶴湾口を東西から博奕岬と金ヶ岬が固めた、天然の良港である。

The entrance to the bay is protected by the Bakuchi Misaki and Kanagamisaki Cape, which form a safe natural harbor.

Mt. Aoba (Kyoto Prefecture and Fukui Prefecture) which lies between the border with Fukui Prefecture (Reinan), is the highest peak in the city. The area from Wakasa bay to the Oura peninsular located in the north-east end of the city is designated as Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 日本海側気候に属し、冬季は北西の季節風の影響で気温が低く、雨や雪が多くなりやすい（代表的な格言：「弁当忘れても傘忘れるな」）。
sen.e: The city belongs to Climate of Japan Sea area and temperature is low in winter due to the northwest seasonal wind and likely to have much rain or snow (they have a famous maxim that "Do not forget to carry your umbrella with you when you go out even if you forget a lunch box"), however, temperature difference in summer and winter is relatively small and it is more bearable climate compared to those of basin area.

The city falls under the Japan Sea Cost Climate with low temperatures in winter owing to the northwest seasonal wind, and sees much rain and snow (the city has a famous maxim stating "Do not forget to carry your umbrella with you when you go out even if you forget your lunch box"). However, temperature differences between summer and winter are relatively small, and its climate is much more comfortable when compared to the basin area.

sen.e: When Mitsunori ISSHIKI became Shugoshoku (post of regional governor) of Tango Province after the foundation of the Government of Muromachi, Kasa-gun including present-day Maizuru became under control of Isshiki family.

sen.e: The Isshiki family was brought to ruin as they went with the Seigun (the western army) at the the Onin War in the late Muromachi Period, and they often received attacks from the Hosokawa clan and the Takeda clan and even suffered the Gekokujo (rebel by their own subordinates and finally the subordinates become the heads), and thus Tangonokuni was in turmoil.

The Isshiki family fell after joining the Seigun (the western army) in the Onin War during the late Muromachi Period. Tangonokuni was then beset with turmoil as it faced constant attacks by the Hosokawa and Takeda clans, as well as Gekokujo (a coup), causing Tangonokuni to become beset with turmoil.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)末期の1575年、織田信長から丹波・丹後進攻の命を受けた家臣の明智光秀と細川幽斎らに侵攻され、旧守護職の一色義道は殺され、一色氏は完全に没落した。
sen.e: In 1575 of the end of the age of civil war, Mitsudhide AKECHI and Yusai HOSOKAWA who were ordered to invade Tamba and Tango by Nobunaga ODA killed ex-Shugoshoku Yoshimichi ISSHIKI, thus Isshiki clan was completely ruined.

In 1575, during the end of the Warring States period, Mitsudhide AKECHI and Yusai HOSOKAWA who were ordered to invade Tamba and Tango by Nobunaga ODA, killed former Shugoshoku Yoshimichi ISSHIKI, leading to the downfall of the Isshiki clan.

In 1575, during the end of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), Mitsuhide AKECHI and Yusai HOSOKAWA who were ordered to invade Tanba and Tango by Nobunaga ODA, killed former Shugoshoku Yoshimichi ISSHIKI, leading to the downfall of the Isshiki clan.
sen.cmt: Warring States period→Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) に変更しました。Tamba→Tanba に変更しました。Mitsudhide→Mitsuhide に変更しました。

sen.j: 信長の命により丹後国は細川藤孝の領地となり、舞鶴が本拠地となった。

sen.j: 舞鶴藩祖・京極高三
sen.e: Primogenitor of the Maizuru clan, Takamitsu KYOGOKU

sen.j: 戦後は京極高知が信濃国飯田藩より入った。
sen.e: After the Battle of Sekigahara, takatomo KYOGOKU was transferred from Iida clan, Shinano Province and governed the whole territory of Tango Province as Tango clan, thus naturally Kasa-gun (Maizuru) as well.

sen.j: 丹後一国を領する丹後藩として加佐郡（舞鶴）も統治した。
sen.e: He then governed the whole territory of Tango Province as the Tango clan, which naturally included Kasa-gun (Maizuru) as well.

sen.j: 後に京極高知の子らにより丹後は分割され、京極高三（京極道誉の末裔）が加佐郡に舞鶴藩（田辺藩）（35000石）を立藩した。
sen.e: Later, Tango clan was divided by the sons of Takatomo KYOGOKU, Takamitsu KYOGOKU (descendant of Doyo KYOGOKU) founded Maizuru clan (Tanabe clan) (35,000 koku (nominal total annual rice crops of the clan; 1koku =5.119U.S. bushels).

The Tango clan was then divided between the sons Takatomo KYOGOKU and Takamitsu KYOGOKU (descendant of Doyo KYOGOKU) who founded the Maizuru clan (Tanabe clan) (35,000 koku (nominal total annual rice crops of the clan; 1koku =5.119U.S. bushels).

The Tango clan was then divided between the Takatomo KYOGOKU's sons, and Takamitsu KYOGOKU (descendant of Doyo KYOGOKU) who founded the Maizuru clan (Tanabe clan) (35,000 koku (nominal total annual rice crops of the clan; 1koku = 5.119 U.S. bushels).
sen.cmt: 原文に合うようにTakatomo KYOGOKUの位置を移動しました。スペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: 京極高三は宮津城の築城にともない廃城（一国一城令）となっていた舞鶴城（田辺城）の再構築や、城下町の整備などを行い、その後の舞鶴発展の礎を築いた。
sen.e: Takamitsu KYOGOKU rebuilt the Maizuru-jo Castle (Tanabe-jo Castle) which was abandoned due to the "One Clan, One Castle" policy of the Tokugawa shogunate, and maintained the castle town and laid a foundation of the prosperity of Maizuru.

Takamitsu KYOGOKU rebuilt the Maizuru-jo Castle (Tanabe-jo Castle) which was abandoned due to the "One Clan, One Castle" policy of the Tokugawa shogunate, and maintained the castle town, laying the foundation for the future development of Maizuru.

Takamitsu KYOGOKU rebuilt Maizuru-jo Castle (Tanabe-jo Castle) which was abandoned due to the "One Clan, One Castle" policy of the Tokugawa shogunate, and maintained the castle town, laying the foundation for the future development of Maizuru.

sen.j: のちに京極家は但馬国豊岡藩へ移封となり、
sen.e: Yet later, the Kyogoku family was transferred to Toyooka clan, Tajima Province, and after that, Tomishige MAKINO, a son-in-law of Takamitsu KYOGOKU inherited Tango Tanabe clan, and the clan had prospered as Makino family 35,000 koku of clan until the end of Edo Period.

Eventually, the Kyogoku family was transferred to the Toyooka clan, Tajima Province. After which, Tomishige MAKINO, a son-in-law of Takamitsu KYOGOKU inherited the Tango Tanabe clan. The clan then prospered as the Makino family, a clan worth 35,000 koku, until the end of Edo Period.

sen.j: その後、紀伊田辺藩との同一藩名を解消するため太政官より田辺藩の名称変更を命じられ、同年6月に田辺城の雅号・舞鶴城に因んで舞鶴藩に改称した。
sen.e: After that, to avoid duplication of clan name with Kii Tanabe clan, the Dajokan (great council of state) ordered to change the name of Tango Tanabe clan, so in the same year, Tanabe clan changed its name to Maizuru clan after pseudonym of Maizuru castle (Tanabe castle).

The Dajokan (great council of state) then ordered that the name of the Tango Tanabe clan be changed, in order to prevent duplicating the name of the Kii Tanabe clan, causing the Tanabe clan to change its name to the Maizuru clan after the pseudonym of Maizuru castle (Tanabe castle), in June of the year.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）には廃藩置県により、西舞鶴は舞鶴県の県庁所在地となった。
sen.e: In 1871, Nishi-Maizuru was designated as the capital of Maizuru ken (Prefecture) once following Haihanchiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), however, in the October of the same year, it is incorporated into Toyooka ken, (Prefecture) and then in 1876, it was incorporated again into Kyoto Fu (Prefecture).

In 1871, Nishi-Maizuru was then designated as the capital of Maizuru-ken (Prefecture) following Haihanchiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures). However, in October of the same year, it was incorporated into Toyooka ken, (Prefecture) and in 1876, was incorporated again into Kyoto Fu (Prefecture).

sen.e: In 1873, a Karou (chief retainer) of Maizuru clan, Shinroku KAWAMURA founded Maizuru City Meirin Elementary School based on the Han school (clan school) of Maizuru, Meirinkan which produced many scholars.

sen.e: In October 1901, Chinju-fu (a large and critical army or naval base) was installed in Higashi-Maizuru as Maizuru was a military choke point, of which the first director was Heihachiro TOGO.

sen.e: Following the city of Kyoto, the streets of the new town district was laid out at right angle (streets are named Ichijo to Kujo from the south to the north, and the name of warships were used from the east to the west). (Cf. Destroyer "Yukikaze" of the Japanese Navy was built in Maizuru)

sen.j: 軍都として順調に発展を遂げた舞鶴であったが、1923年（大正12年）2月のワシントン海軍軍縮条約締結に伴い、舞鶴鎮守府は海軍要港部に格下げされ、同時に海軍工廠も工作部に縮小された。
sen.e: Although Maizuru had successfully been developing as a military capital, according to the Washington Naval Treaty in February 1923, Maizuru Chinju-fu was scaled down to Critical Naval Department and the Naval Arsenal was also ranked down to Naval Factory Department, and as a result, population of the city temprally decreased and economy became sluggish accordingly.
sen.cmt: 海軍要港部(Critical Naval Department)、工作部(Naval Factory Department)。定訳不明に付き適訳にしています。
sen.e: Although Maizuru saw successful development as a military capital, according to the Washington Naval Treaty in February 1923, Maizuru Chinju-fu was scaled down to a Critical Naval Department with the Naval Arsenal also being reduced to a Naval Factory Department. As a result, the population of the city temporarily decreased, slowing the economy.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）になるといよいよ戦局が激化すると、舞鶴鎮守府は日本海軍の重要拠点として強化される事となり、東舞鶴市（東舞鶴地区）だけではなく、旧舞鶴市（西舞鶴地区）にも海軍諸施設が多数立地するようになった。
sen.e: In 1943, along with the aggravation of the war situation, Maizuru Chinju-fu was enhanced its function as the Japanese Naval base, and the many naval facilities were built not only in Higashi-Miazuru City (Higashi Maizuru region) but also in Old Maizuru City (Nishi Maizuru region).

In 1943, together with the acceleration of war, Maizuru Chinju-fu enhanced its function as a Japanese Naval base, and many naval facilities were built not only in Higashi-Maizuru City (Higashi Maizuru region) but also in Old Maizuru City (Nishi Maizuru region).

sen.j: 現在において与党的な立場にある保守2会派に加え、民主党系の翔友会も市長の市政運営を評価している。
sen.e: Today, adding to the ruling party-sided conservative 2 factions, Democratic Party line Shoyukai also appraises mayor's municipal government administrations.
Today, adding to the ruling party-sided conservative 2 factions, the Democratic Party line Shoyukai also appraises the mayor's municipal government administrations.
Today, adding to the ruling party-sided conservative 2 factions, the Democratic Party line Shoyukai also appraises the mayor's municipal government administrations.

sen.j: なお、2005年12月に無所属議員らによって新会派・市民フォーラム・舞鶴が結成された。
sen.e: Independent assembly members formed a new faction, People's Forum Maizuru in December 2005.
Independent assembly members formed a new faction, the People's Forum Maizuru in December 2005.
Independent assembly members formed a new faction, the People's Forum Maizuru, in December 2005.
sen.cmt: I'm afraid I don't really see the connection between the use of the word "faction" and whether it has only just been formed or not. The word faction means "a group within a larger group, especially one with slightly different ideas from the main group" (according to the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary) and I think this pretty much matches the meaning of 会派 here.

sen.j: 現在の市議会においては日本共産党を除く各政党でオール与党体制を構築しているといわれている。
sen.e: In the current city assembly, it is said that all parties except the Japanese Communist Party constitute the so-called all-ruling-party system.
In the current city assembly, it is said that all parties except the Japanese Communist Party constitute the all-ruling-party system.
In the current city assembly, it is said that all parties except the Japanese Communist Party constitute the all-ruling-party system.

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）11月19日の市議会議員選挙では30名の定員に対して32人が立候補。
sen.e: At the election of the city assembly held on November 19, 2006, 32 became candidates against the quorum 30 seats and the election was severely contested among the selected few just like the previous time, and generally mayor-sided ruling-party like conservative line candidates garnered the votes.

At the election of the city assembly held on November 19, 2006, 32 became candidates against a quorum of 30 seats. As what happened previously, the election was severely contested among the selected few, with mayor-sided ruling-party candidates, such as those of the conservative line candidates generally garnering the votes.
At the election of the city assembly held on November 19, 2006, 32 candidates ran for 30 available seats.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処意味不明瞭”32 became candidates against a quorum of 30 seats. “ → ” 32 candidates ran for 30 available seats.”

sen.j: 前回に引き続き少数激戦となり、総じて市長与党的な立場にある保守系議員が得票を伸ばした。
sen.e: As had happened previously, the election was strongly contested, with mayor-supporting ruling-party candidates, such as those of a conservative bent generally garnering the votes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処意味不明瞭。全体を訳し直しました。

sen.j: なお、この後の議会より特別委員会を、従来の4特別委員会から3特別委員会に再編した。

After the election, the number of special committees was reduced from four to three.
sen.cmt: スペース を削除しました。

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）2月11日の市長選挙では現職の江守光起が引退を表明した事から、市立舞鶴市民病院の諸問題（民間病院への業務委託の是非）と江守市政の継続を唱えて前助役が、谷垣禎一・伊吹文明ら国会議員と一部の府会議員および自民党に推薦された。
sen.e: At the mayor election held on February 11, 2007, as the incumbent mayor Mitsuoki EMORI expressed his retirement, previous deputy mayor who raised the problems of Maizuru Municipal Hospital (pros and cons regarding private consignment of its management) and adovocated the continuation of the EMORI administrations, and recommended by MP such as Sadakazu TANIGAKI/Bunmei IBUKI, some of the Kyoto Prefectural assembly members and LDP, while ex-city assembly member and the previous prefectural assembly member, SAITO ran the race for mayor as an independent candidate backed by the ex-hospital director of the Maizuru Municipal Hospital and the relatives of the (now defunct) ex-Maizuru mayor, thus the conservatives were split.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: At the mayoral election held on February 11, 2007, as the incumbent mayor Mitsuoki EMORI announced his retirement, the previous deputy mayor who raised such problems involving the Maizuru Municipal Hospital (pros and cons regarding private consignment of its management), and advocated the continuation of the EMORI administrations, was recommended by MP such as Sadakazu TANIGAKI/Bunmei IBUKI, some Kyoto Prefecture assembly members and the LDP. At the same time the former city assembly member and previous prefecture assembly member, SAITO, ran the race for mayor as an independent candidate backed by the former hospital director for Maizuru Municipal Hospital and relatives of the (now defunct) former Maizuru mayor, resulting in a split among the conservatives.

At the mayoral election held on February 11, 2007, after the incumbent mayor Mitsuoki EMORI had announced his retirement, the previous deputy mayor, who had raised problems such as those involving the Maizuru Municipal Hospital (the pros and cons of private consignment of its management), and advocated the continuation of the EMORI administrations, was recommended by Mps such as Sadakazu TANIGAKI/Bunmei IBUKI, some Kyoto Prefecture assembly members and the LDP.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処意味不明瞭。全体を訳し直しました。

sen.j: また、元市民病院院長や元舞鶴市長（故人）の親族の応援を得て無所属で出馬した元舞鶴市会議員で前府会議員の斎藤によって保守分裂した。
sen.e: At the same time the former city assembly member and previous prefecture assembly member, SAITO, ran the race for mayor as an independent candidate backed by the former hospital director for Maizuru Municipal Hospital and relatives of the (now defunct) former Maizuru mayor, resulting in a split among the conservatives.

sen.j: 2007年度（平成19年）の一般会計は322億3403万円で、医師不足で機能縮小を余儀なくされている舞鶴市民病院への補助助成や舞鶴港貿易振興事業費などに重点をおくもので、
sen.e: General account of Maizuru in FY 2007 was \32,234,030,000 and weighed on the assistance to the Maizuru Municipal Hospital's management where doctors were short and was obliged to lessen its function, as well as trade promotion project expenditure of the Maizuru Port, which was 0.4% decrease from the previous year.

The general account for Maizuru in FY 2007 was \32,234,030,000 which weighed on assistance provided to the Maizuru Municipal Hospital's, which faced a shortage of doctors and cutbacks in various functions, together with focus placed on trade promotion project expenditure towards the Maizuru Port. Overall, a 0.4% decrease from the previous year was seen.

The general account for Maizuru in FY 2007 was \32,234,030,000 which weighed on assistance provided to the Maizuru Municipal Hospital, which faced a shortage of doctors and cutbacks in various functions, together with focus placed on trade promotion project expenditure towards the Maizuru Port.

Although Maizuru Citys' finances are favorable compared among the rest of the northern Kyoto autonomous bodies, the city has concerns including depopulation, Maizuru Municipal Hospital management, etc. Maizuru City is poised to tackle these issues through administrative reform in its policies.

sen.j: 舞鶴市は、京都府北部の経済・行政の中心都市として、また舞鶴港を擁することから多くの国の出先機関が置かれている。
sen.e: Maizuru City has many national branch offices as the city is the northern center of economy and administration of the Kyoto Prefecture, and also has a large port of Maizuru.
Maizuru City has many national branch offices as the city is the northern center of economy and administration for Kyoto Prefecture, while also possessing the port of Maizuru.
Maizuru City has many national branch offices as the city is the northern center of economy and administration for Kyoto Prefecture, while also possessing the port of Maizuru.

sen.j: 京都地方裁判所舞鶴支部は、北部の4支部のなかで唯一、地裁の合議事件、家裁の少年事件を受け持っている。
sen.e: Kyoto District Court Maizuru Branch is the only branch that has function to handle collegial incidents of the district court, and criminal cases involving juveniles of the family court among the northern 4 branches.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理、「合議事件」不明でcollegial incidentsとしています。
sen.e: Kyoto District Court Maizuru Branch is the only branch among the four northern branches that has functions to handle collegial incidents of the district court, as well as criminal cases of the family court involving juveniles.

Kyoto District Court Maizuru Branch is the only branch among the four northern branches that has functions to handle cases in banc at the district court, as well as criminal cases of the family court involving juveniles.
sen.cmt: The number of hits for "collegial cases" is a little misleading as the first hit, for example, has a period between "collegial" and "cases". I asked Hino-san (who now works at SunFlare Academy) if he could help with this and replied as follows:=====合議事件とは、要するに1人の裁判官ではなく3人の裁判官が協議して審理する事件のことですね。 合議事件と単独事件の区別に関してわかりやすい説明があるので、以下のwebページをご参考までに http://www.courts.go.jp/saiban/qa/qa_keizi/qa_keizi_19.htmlちなみに「合議事件」は日本法の用語なので、英米法の用語と100パーセント一致するわけではありませんが、"cases in banc"はほぼ同じ趣旨の表現かと思います。=====So I think the following would work OK here:...to handle cases in banc at the district court,...

sen.j: 法務省管轄施設である拘置所も北部では唯一、舞鶴拘置支所だけにある。

Additionally, the detention center, which is under control of the Ministry of Justice, is the only one in the northern area attached to the Maizuru Detention Branch.

sen.j: 舞鶴市は戦前・戦中は鎮守府も置かれ、軍都として軍需産業、また戦後は臨海型重厚長大工業都市とだった。
sen.e: As Maizuru City was a military arsenal city that had a Chinju-fu and the military capital accordingly before and during the war, and has long been a oceanfront-type heavy industrial city since the end of war, Maizuru has the largest economic scale in the Kita-kinki region.

As Maizuru City was a munitions city that had a Chinju-fu with military capital before and during the war, it has long been a oceanfront-type heavy industrial city since the end of war. As a result, Maizuru has the largest economic scale in the Kita-kinki region.

Since Maizuru City was for a long time a munitions city that had a Chinju-fu with a military capital both before and during the war, it has been an oceanfront-type heavy industrial city since the end of war.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処文法 “long been” と “since” 同時に使用は不自然。

sen.j: 北近畿最大の経済規模を有する。
sen.e: As a result, Maizuru has the largest economy in the Kita-kinki region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処意味不明瞭。 “has the largest economic scale ” → “has the largest economy”

sen.j: しかしながら現在は産業構造の変化や、慢性的な土地不足のため経済は停滞気味である。
sen.e: However, now Maizuru suffers from change of industrial structures and chronic shortage of effective land, and the economy has been sluggish.
However, now Maizuru suffers from a change in industrial structures, chronic shortages in usable land, as well as a sluggish economy.
However, now economy has been sluggish because Maizuru suffers from a change in industrial structures and chronic shortages in usable land.
sen.cmt: 原文に合うように, as well as a sluggish economyの位置を中心に全体を修正しました。

sen.j: 近年は海上自衛隊舞鶴総監部の増員などがあるものの、舞鶴に立地している企業の支店統合等により人口の減少が続いている。

Recently though, Maritime Self-Defense Force Maizuru District Headquarters increased personnel, as numbers of local branches of firms located in Maizuru had been decreasing due to mergers, resulting in a decrease of the population. Today's figures are 3% less compared to 97,780 in 1975.

Recently, although the Maritime Self-Defense Force Maizuru District Headquarters has increased personnel, the numbers of local branches of firms located in Maizuru has been decreasing due to mergers, resulting in a decrease of the population.

sen.j: 1975年（昭和50年）の人口97,780人と比べると現在は約3％減少している。

The Maizuru urban area includes the whole of Maizuru City, the entire Takahama-cho town, Oi-gun Fukui Prefecture and part of Oi-cho town/Ayabe City/Miyazu City. The total population for the market area is estimated to be about 120,000.

sen.j: 1995年に「らぽーる」（後述）が出来るまでは、大規模小売店は西舞鶴に一箇所（さとう舞鶴店）しか無く、駅前商店街（東舞鶴：三条・八島・大門商店街、西舞鶴：マナイ商店街）が競争とは無縁な経営を続けていた。
sen.e: Until La Port (explained later) was built, there were no mass merchandising stores other than one store in Nishi-Maizuru (Sato Maizuru), and shopping district near the train station (Higashi-Maizuru: Sanjo/Yashima/Omon malls and Nishi-Maizuru: Manai mall) operated business without severe competitions.

Until the development of La Port (explained later), there were no mass merchandising stores other than one store in Nishi-Maizuru (Sato Maizuru), and a shopping district near the train station (Higashi-Maizuru: Sanjo/Yashima/Omon malls and Nishi-Maizuru: Manai mall) which was able to operate without severe competition.

Until the development of La Port (explained later) in 1995, there were no mass merchandising stores other than one store in Nishi-Maizuru (Sato Maizuru), and a shopping district near the train station (Higashi-Maizuru: Sanjo/Yashima/Omon malls and Nishi-Maizuru: Manai mall) which was able to operate without severe competition.

sen.j: 近年では東舞鶴駅前に平和堂系列の「エール (京都府)」（本社：舞鶴市、1995年開業）が進出し、西舞鶴にも駅東側にさとう (京都府)系列の「バザールタウン舞鶴」（2000年開業）、駅前に「さとう舞鶴店」が出店している。
sen.e: In recent year, Al (Kyoto Prefecture, head office is in Maizuru City. Opened in 1995) of the Heiwa-do group moved in front of the Higashi-Maizuru station, and also around Nishi-Maizuru station, Bazaar Town Maizuru (Sato group, Kyoto Prefecture, opened in 2000) moved in at the east side of the station, and Sato Maizuru operates in front of the station.

sen.e: In recent years, Al (Kyoto Prefecture, head office is in Maizuru City. The Bazaar Town Maizuru (Sato group, Kyoto Prefecture, opened in 2000) moved in to the east side of the station, with Sato Maizuru operating in front of the station.
In recent years, Al (Kyoto Prefecture, head office is in Maizuru City. Opened in 1995) of the Heiwa-do group moved in front of the Higashi-Maizuru station.

sen.j: また東西両舞鶴市街地を結ぶ白鳥街道（京都府道28号小倉西舞鶴線）沿いや、西舞鶴の国道27号線沿いには郊外型飲食店や娯楽施設、大規模小売店などが立地するなど、北近畿の商業地域として近隣市町村にその商圏を広げている。
sen.e: Besides, alongside the Shiraori Kaido Road(Kyoto Prefectural Road No.28, Ogura Nishi Maizuru Line) connecting the east and the west town areas of Maizuru, and alongside the National Road No.27 in Nishi-Maizuru, suburban type restaurants, entertainment facilities and large-scaled suburban stores moved in, and market area is extending to the neighboring municipalities as new Kita-kinki market area.

sen.j: 舞鶴市は戦中の一時期は人口20万人を数える日本海側での一大工業都市であったが、現在では相対的に地位が低下している。

Though Maizuru City used to be the largest industrial city among the Japan Sea coastal cities, and temporarily held a population of about 200,000 during WWII, today its rank in this aspect has been relatively lowered.

sen.j: しかしながら今なお京都府北部では経済的中心都市として重要な地位を占めているばかりか、畿内に最も近い日本海側の拠点である。
sen.e: However, Maizuru City is still at an important position as an economical center of northern Kyoto, and the closest port of Japan Sea to Kinai area (territories in the vicinity of the capital and under direct imperial rule, the five kuni in the immediate vicinity of Kyoto), thus the Prefecture and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism prepared to maintain the port as a critical point and widen the function of the new port Wada Warf (tentative name) that harbor larger vessels and handles containers.

Thus the Prefecture and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism is prepared to maintain the port as a critical point and widened the function of the new port Wada Warf (tentative name) will harbor larger vessels and handle containers.

sen.j: 舞鶴市では京都弁とも福井弁とも違う独特の方言で「ちゃった」に代表される舞鶴弁（ちゃった弁）がある。
sen.e: In Maizuru City, there is Maizuru-ben dialect (Chatta-ben dialect) represented by postfix,"chatta" which is unique to their dialect and quite different from Kyoto-ben dialect or even from Fukui-ben dialect

In Maizuru City, the Maizuru-ben dialect (Chatta-ben dialect) is represented by postfix,"chatta" which is unique to the dialect and quite different from the Kyoto-ben dialect or even the Fukui-ben dialect.

In Maizuru City, the Maizuru-ben dialect (Chatta-ben dialect) is represented by the postfix, 'chatta' which is unique to the dialect and quite different from the Kyoto-ben dialect or even the Fukui-ben dialect.

sen.j: 前述の「ちゃった」の使用例である「－しちゃった」は標準語では「－された」である。
sen.e: "~Shichatta", a usage example of the aforementioned "chatta" is "~sareta"(respectful form of "shita" or did of the 2nd or 3rd person) " in standard Japanese language.
"~Shichatta", a usage example of the aforementioned "chatta" is "~sareta"(respectful form of "shita" or did of the 2nd or 3rd person) " in the standard Japanese language.
~Shichatta,' a usage example of the aforementioned 'chatta' is '~sareta' (respectful form of 'shita' or did of the 2nd or 3rd person)' in the standard Japanese language.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にコンマを'内に移動しました。スペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: また舞鶴弁の「－しとってん」は標準語でいう「－しているの？」の疑問形であり、大阪弁の「しとってん」として使われる過去形とは全く異なり、発音のイントネーションが明らかに違う。
sen.e: Further, "~Shitotten" in Maizuru-ben dialect is the same as interrogative "~Shiteiruno?"(Are you doing ~) in standard Japanese language while the same "~Shitotten" in Osaka-ben dialect is a past form,"~shite-ita" (I was doing ~) of standard Japanese and completely different from Maizuru-ben dialect in its meaning and also its intonation.

Further, "~Shitotten" in Maizuru-ben dialect is the same as the interrogative "~Shiteiruno?"(Are you doing ~) in standard Japanese language while the same "~Shitotten" in Osaka-ben dialect is a past form,"~shite-ita" (I was doing ~) of standard Japanese and completely different from the Maizuru-ben dialect in its meaning and intonation.

Further, '~Shitotten' in Maizuru-ben dialect is the same as the interrogative '~Shiteiruno?' (Are you doing ~) in standard Japanese language while the same '~Shitotten' in Osaka-ben dialect is a past form, '~shite-ita' (I was doing ~) of standard Japanese and completely different from the Maizuru-ben dialect in its meaning and intonation.
sen.cmt: スペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: 日本海側中心に位置する軍港であったためか、基本的に関東弁、関西弁と違い、標準語に限りなく近い言語、発音であるのが特色である。
sen.e: The language and its pronunciation of Maizuru is very close to standard Japanese language and basically different from Kanto-ben dialect and Kansai-ben dialect, too, perhaps due to the fact that Maizuru was a naval base port city located in a center of Japan Sea coast.

sen.j: 疑問文の語尾に付ける「～か？」が、京都や大阪等では「～け？」となることが有るが、舞鶴では「～こ？」となる。
sen.e: In Kyoto or Osaka, many people put postfix "ke?" instead of standard "ka?" in interrogative sentence, however, in Maizuru, this "ka" or "ke" turns to "ko?".
In Kyoto or Osaka, many people put the postfix "ke?" instead of standard "ka?" in interrogative sentence, however, in Maizuru, this "ka" or "ke" turns to "ko?".

sen.j: この「～こ？」には京都の人間もかなりの違和感を感じる。
sen.e: It is said people of Kyoto feel odd much with this "~ko?"

sen.j: 「っ」を多く使うことが有る。

sen.e: Based on this common characteristic of Maizuru-ben dialect, they have created local hero "Maizuru Bouei-sentai Chatta-man" (the Maizuru Guardian Chatta-man) and he is popular in many local events.

sen.j: 1991年（平成3年）3月26日に舞鶴自動車道（現・舞鶴若狭自動車道）の福知山インターチェンジ - 舞鶴西インターチェンジ間が開通し、市内初の高速道路が開通した。
sen.e: On March 26th, 1991, Maizuru Express Way (today's Maizuru-Wakasa Express Way) between Fukuchiyama Interchange and Maizuru-nishi Interchange opened and became the first Automobile Express Way in Maizuru City.

On March 26th, 1991, the Maizuru Express Way (today's Maizuru-Wakasa Express Way) between Fukuchiyama Interchange and Maizuru-nishi Interchange opened to became the first Automobile Express Way in Maizuru City.

On March 26, 1991, the Maizuru Express Way (today's Maizuru-Wakasa Express Way) between Fukuchiyama Interchange and Maizuru-nishi Interchange opened to became the first Automobile Express Way in Maizuru City.
sen.cmt: 日付の表記を変更しました。

sen.j: また 1998年（平成10年）3月8日には京都縦貫自動車道の舞鶴大江インターチェンジが開通。
sen.e: Adding to the above, on March 8th, 1998, Maizuru Oe Interchange of the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway was completed, and on 18th, long-sought Maizuru-nishi Interchange and Maizuru-higashi Interchange opened and finally the first express way network was completed.

Additionally, on March 8th, 1998, Maizuru Oe Interchange of the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway was completed. On the 18th, the long awaited Maizuru-nishi Interchange and Maizuru-higashi Interchange opened, heralding the completion of the first express way network.
Additionally, on March 8, 1998, the Maizuru Oe Interchange of the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway was completed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処文法

sen.j: 同年3月18日には念願であった舞鶴西IC～舞鶴東IC間が開通し、ようやく高速道路網が整備された。
sen.e: On the 18th, the long awaited Maizuru-nishi Interchange and Maizuru-higashi Interchange opened, heralding the completion of the first express way network.

sen.j: 2006年（平成17年）11月8日に舞鶴市東地区と綾部市上林地区を結ぶ、京都府の府道一覧京都府道51号舞鶴和知線の「菅坂バイパス」（延長2.3キロ）が開通した。
sen.e: On November 8th, 2006, "Sugasaka By-pass" of Kyoto Prefectural Road No. 51, Maizuru Wachi Line (total extension 2.3km), connecting Maizuru City Higashi area and Ayabe City Kambayashi area opened.
On November 8th, 2006, "Sugasaka By-pass" of Kyoto Prefectural Road No. 51, Maizuru Wachi Line (total extension 2.3km), connecting Maizuru City Higashi area and Ayabe City Kambayashi area opened.

sen.j: 室町時代から安土桃山時代にわたって丹後国の国府として発展した舞鶴には、数多くの史跡がある。
sen.e: As Maizuru had developed as Kokufu (provincial capital) of Tango Province from Muromachi Period to Azuch-Momoyama Period, it has many historic sites.
Maizuru has many historic sites, owing to its development as Kokufu (provincial capital) of Tango Province from the Muromachi to Azuch-Momoyama Period.
Maizuru has many historic sites, owing to its development as Kokufu (provincial capital) of Tango Province from the Muromachi to Azuchi-Momoyama Period.

sen.j: また、かつて舞鶴鎮守府が設置されていた関係で、旧海軍に由来する施設も多い。
sen.e: And also as Maizuru Chinju-fu was located, there are many old navy related facilities.
Also, due to the location of Maizuru Chinju-fu, many old navy related facilities are still located in the area.
Also, due to the location of Maizuru Chinju-fu, many old navy related facilities are still located in the area.
